intro: Spermacoce longiseta, commonly known as the long-haired senna, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by distinctive, inflated, spiny fruits. Native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia, it thrives in moist, shady environments. Its botanical features make it a notable species in ecological and horticultural contexts.
